metadata.title: CVE-2023-32254 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the processing ofSMB2_TREE_DISCONNECT commands. The issue results from the lack of properlocking when performing operations on an object. An attacker can leveragethis vulnerability to execute code in the context of the kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32254` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-102-generic - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-5.15.0-102-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-102-generic - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-102-generic-64k - 5.15.0-102.112
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-102.112').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needed').
